Kõnele • %2$s · %1$s %2$s · %1$s [ %1$s ] · ✓ speech-to-text services for Android apps Kõnele speak & swipe Kõnele (grammar support) Kõnele (fast recognition) Kõnele (fast recognition 2) Kõnele (DEMO) @string/labelApp About Kõnele Kõnele settings @string/labelRecognitionServiceHttp @string/labelRecognitionServiceWs Kõnele rewrite rules Rewrite rule tables Apps Grammars Recognizer servers Simple demo Extras demo Handsfree demo Chat demo Voice search demo Other tests/demos HTML form demo Quick settings Save the rewrites table as: or overwrite an existing table: Share the rewrites table Search Search" Filter rewrites name HTTP URL Voice search panel Apps, Grammars, Rewrites Speak & swipe keyboard Recognition services For developers Demos, tests, etc. @string/labelRecognitionServiceHttp @string/labelRecognitionServiceWs Supports Estonian and Grammatical Framework. Based on an HTTP-server. Supports Estonian and fast/accurate recognition. Based on a WebSocket-server. Developer settings, demos, tools Auto start Start recording automatically Auto stop after pause Stop recording after a few seconds of pause Max recording time Stop recording after %1$s seconds Swiping Partial results Show partial recognition results in the text field Support device language Assume that the input speech is in the device\'s default language, unless the app sets a different language Sample rate Sampling %1$s times per second Audio format %1$s\n(Using a non-raw format results in 2x less network traffic. Requires at least Android v4.1 or even v5.0, and might not work on all devices.) Play audio cues Beep before and after recording WebSocket URL %1$s Help text Show usage instructions by the microphone button. Makes the search panel larger. Return errors Return network/audio/etc. errors to the caller (useful if the caller does error handling) Help text Show usage instructions by the microphone button. Makes the keyboard larger. Updating… Enable Kõnele keyboard The Kõnele keyboard allows you to dictate into any text field in any app, and modify the text with some swipe operations. Tap here to enable it in the Android virtual keyboard settings. List of apps where you have used speech input List of grammars that translate the raw transcription into app-specific language Demonstrates the simplest way of using the speech recognizer Shows only the "result extras" returned by the recognizer Repeatedly calls the speech recognizer and shows the best transcription. Grammar can be assigned to the input (via menu). Chat-style UI for calling intents Forwards the results to a search app Various other tests and demos (recording, audio compression, voice IMEs, etc.) HTML form with various types of fields for testing the IME Recognition languages & services Languages & services All recognition services System-wide settings of all the installed speech recognition services, as well as the Assist-app. Rewrites List of available rewrite rule tables that can be used to rewrite the transcription. Quick settings Quickly apply some common default settings Run GetPutPreference without confirmation Allow GetPutPreference to change preferences without user confirmation. This allows rewrite rules, or ADB scripts, or 3rd party apps to change multiple Kõnele settings without the user having to confirm each change. Do not enable this setting, unless you know what you are doing. Recognition hypotheses Output only the most likely recognition hypothesis Output at most %d recognition hypotheses Tap & Speak Tap & Speak Speak now! Tap when finished Speak now! Pause when finished Yes No OK Go to settings Cancel Transcribing… Still transcribing…

%1$s is an app that offers speech-to-text services to other apps. Many apps contain a text area or a text field (e.g. a search bar) that can be edited using the keyboard. %1$s provides a keyboard that allows text to be entered and edited via speech. Some apps (e.g. intelligent assistants, navigation apps) also contain a microphone button that is either linked to the standard Android speech recognition activity or the standard Android speech recognition service. %1$s implements both the activity and the service.

How to use the Kõnele keyboard? Tap the big yellow button and start dictating, the words appear immediately in the text area. Swipe left to delete the previous word, swipe right to add a newline, double-tap to add space, long-press to select all text (e.g. to dictate over it). Rewrite rules allow you to define voice commands to edit an existing text.

How to use the voice search activity? Its user interface is similar to the speech keyboard but because the transcription is immediately executed (e.g. loaded into a web browser) or returned to the caller (e.g. a navigation app), there is no support for editing commands (such as the swipe operations).

Kõnele can use any speech recognition service on the device, but it also comes with two services of its own. Each of these uses a separate cloud-based speech recognition server. One supports grammar-based speech recognition, the other supports continuous full-duplex speech recognition. Both servers focus on Estonian speech recognition, but both are based on a fully open-source stack that makes them easy to deploy and customize for other languages. For more information, see http://phon.ioc.ee.

For the documentation, source code, etc. see the %1$s website. See also the privacy policy.

No apps yet. This list will be automatically populated with the apps where you have used speech input. No grammars. Add a new grammar via the Add-menu. No servers. Add a new server via the Add-menu. No rewrite rule tables. Add a table via the Add-menu or by exporting it from a spreadsheet app as a TSV-file. No rewrite rules were found. Make sure the input file is in the correct format, i.e. the columns are tab-separated and the first line is a header.
